availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Kentucky. Attended West Point from 1840 to 1844. Fought in the Mexican War where he achieved the rank of 1st Lieutenant. After the war he became superintendent of the Louisville Lexington and Frankfort Railroad. In 1860 he maintained that position. Served as a commissioner on the Military Board of Kentucky from 1861 to 1862. Died January 18, 1876 in Cincinnati .

bibl.p: The Centennial of the United States Military Accademy at West Point, New York, vol. II, (Washington DC: Government Printing Office, 1904), 409; Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, (Covington, Ky: Collins & Co., 1882), 90-91. "Appendix," Kentucky State Historical Society, Register of the Kentucky State Historical Society 9, no. 26 (1911): 33.
